item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 at 3:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Busy Status Bar (913 points | 298 comments)
2. The Physics of Magic Windows (2021) (64 points | 3 comments)
3. Commonly used arm positions can overestimate blood pressure readings: study (184 points | 133 comments)
4. Turn your Android phone into a modern ham radio transceiver (258 points | 88 comments)
5. The web I want vs. the one we have (31 points | 26 comments)
6. Gosub – An open-source browser engine (172 points | 112 comments)
7. Zamba2-7B (179 points | 31 comments)
8. Show HN: Vortex – a high-performance columnar file format (152 points | 35 comments)
9. DeepSeek: Advancing theorem proving in LLMs through large-scale synthetic data (133 points | 33 comments)
10. Automating the most annoying aspects of blogging (19 points | 5 comments)
11. Google commits to buying power generated by nuclear-energy startup Kairos Power (421 points | 268 comments)
12. Play 3.0 mini – A lightweight, reliable, cost-efficient Multilingual TTS model (132 points | 41 comments)
13. Show HN: X11 tool to share a screen area in any video meeting (236 points | 112 comments)
14. Extracting financial disclosure and police reports with OpenAI Structured Output (150 points | 30 comments)
15. Remains of an ancient Greek structure found in Croatia (59 points | 17 comments)

18. 0 → 1, Shipping Threads in 5 Months (4 points | discuss)
19. PayloadCMS: Open-Source, Fullstack Next.js Framework (110 points | 36 comments)
20. The three-page paper that shook philosophy: Gettiers in software engineering (106 points | 68 comments)
21. New images show state of preservation of Ernest Shackleton's ship (72 points | 23 comments)
22. Project Euler #912: Where are the Odds? (128 points | 53 comments)
23. How I Experience Web Today (2021) (303 points | 95 comments)
24. Tesla Optimus Bots Were Remotely Operated at Cybercab Event (165 points | 113 comments)
25. The Wes Cook Archive (46 points | 8 comments)
26. Sound Lab – A Simple Analogue Synthesiser (72 points | 10 comments)
27. Cargo Airships Are Happening (41 points | 26 comments)
28. Meissonic, High-Resolution Text-to-Image Synthesis on consumer graphics cards (51 points | 3 comments)
29. Teaching the Largest Programming Lesson (31 points | 2 comments)
30. Can a biologist fix a radio? What I learned while studying apoptosis (2002) [pdf] (40 points | 10 comments)
